abstract: A Boolean value that indicates whether the element provides analog data.
overview:
## Discussion

If this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], the input value defined by the element can return a range (from a minimum to maximum) of possible values. For example, this element might be a pressure-sensitive button or an axis of a thumbstick that allows for a range of physical movement. If this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false], the input value is a discrete value, such as `0` if the element is off, and `1` if the element is on.

# isAnalog

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that indicates whether the element provides analog data.

## Declaration

```swift
var isAnalog: Bool { get }
```

## Discussion

If this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], the input value defined by the element can return a range (from a minimum to maximum) of possible values. For example, this element might be a pressure-sensitive button or an axis of a thumbstick that allows for a range of physical movement. If this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false], the input value is a discrete value, such as `0` if the element is off, and `1` if the element is on.
title: isAnalog
